ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Left Inferior Colliculus Lesion (Midbrain)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Confirmed by CT scan showing a lesion in the left posterior midbrain limited to the inferior colliculus; consistent with contralateral deficits on dichotic digits.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Baseline evaluation of peripheral hearing sensitivity.
Assessment of speech recognition in quiet.
To determine if the ABR is sensitive to a lesion at the level of the inferior colliculus.
Behavioral central auditory test to assess processing, given the midbrain lesion.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrated normal peripheral hearing and normal ABR results, indicating that the auditory pathway up to the lateral lemniscus/inferior colliculus level is intact and that the lesion did not disrupt ABR generation. However, central auditory testing (dichotic digits) revealed a bilateral deficit, worse in the right ear (contralateral to the left midbrain lesion), consistent with dysfunction at the level of the inferior colliculus.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally (thresholds 0-10 dB HL).

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: Normal waves I through V for both ears; wave V latency ~5.5-5.8 ms. The lesion did not affect wave generation.

tests.name: Dichotic Digits
tests.result_summary: Bilateral abnormality, with the right ear (72%) showing a greater deficit than the left (85%).

tests.name: CT Scan
tests.result_summary: Lesion in the left posterior midbrain, essentially limited to the inferior colliculus (likely a lipoma).

counseling_actions: Explain that standard hearing tests and the ABR are normal, indicating the pathway up to the lower brainstem is working well.
Clarify that the lesion is located higher in the auditory pathway (midbrain).
Discuss the results of the dichotic digits test, noting the difficulty in the right ear is expected due to the left-sided brain lesion affecting processing of competing information.

escalation.rationale_short: Patient is already under the care of a neurologist for seizures; this was a research evaluation.

follow_up_plan.objective: Return to neurologist for ongoing management of seizure disorder.
